with_entry: The table name that may be used to further specify the column. Optional if the column_id are unique for the study (either due to orgnial data structure or construction in the read function).
The column name or header or identifier that links to the table being annotated. When combined with the table_id, this must be a unique identifer for column-level information.
The property or variable that the information in this column is associated with.
The dimension or type of information associated with a specific variable and column

value|the observation or measurement;definition|a human readable definition of the variable;unit|unit of measure for the observation;description|a description that may be a definition of the observation type;control_vocabulary|paired term definitions used to describe the variable;identifier|part of a unique identifier for a datum, for example a row or column identifier in a data table;foreign_key|an identifier shared between tables that matches with a different column name;method|a description or code of the method used for an observation;note|a free text note associated with an observation;standard_deviation|the standard deviation of a datum;size|the size of a constructed observation;minimum_threshold|the minimum posible value of an observation (ex mass can not be negative);maximum_threshold|the maximum possible value of an observation (ex pH can not be larger then 14)
the entry associated with the id-variable-type tuple or a '--' to denote reference to the data table being annotated
